text: Acme Corp shall pay John Doe USD 5,000,000 within 30 days of invoice dated 15th March 2025. Interest at 6% per annum will be charged on overdue amounts.
XYZ Bank shall charge Jane Smith 2% penalty on late payments exceeding 60 days. All invoices must be cleared within 45 days from receipt in New York, USA.
The borrower, Michael Johnson, may prepay the loan of USD 2,500,000 in whole or in part without penalty, provided 30 days’ prior notice is given.
Payments of EUR 1,200,000 are due to Global Tech Ltd within 60 days of invoice date 1st April 2025.
Confidential information shared between ABC Ltd and John Doe shall not be disclosed to any third party for a period of 5 years.
Collateral for the loan includes real estate valued at USD 3,500,000 located in London, UK.
Force majeure events such as earthquakes, floods, and pandemics shall excuse liability of the parties.
The agreement will automatically renew for 12 months unless either party provides written notice of termination.
Taxes of 1.5% shall be applied on all payments made to clients based in Germany.
Any disputes arising will be resolved through arbitration in Singapore as per governing law.
Beta Financial Inc will lend Mary Jane EUR 750,000 at a fixed interest rate of 4% per annum. The loan must be repaid within five years.
Triple A Services agrees that a service fee of USD 120,000 will be paid upfront by the Client before the contract commencement date of 1st January 2025.
Client company Delta LLC shall reimburse all travel and lodging costs within 20 days of expense submission.
Loan agreement between Omega Bank and Robert Brown states that interest shall be computed monthly at 1.8%.
If the borrower misses three consecutive payments, a default interest of 5% per month will be charged and a penalty of USD 50,000 applied.
The board member, Alice Green, shall receive commission of 0.75% for every transaction above EUR 200,000 made by the client.
This contract shall be governed by the laws of Canada and disputes must be resolved in Toronto.
The lender, Star Financial, may call for early repayment if the borrower’s credit rating falls below BBB on or after 1st July 2026.
If either party gives a 45‑day notice, the contract terminates. Notice must be delivered in writing to New York, USA.
Loan amount of INR 10,000,000 will be disbursed to Priya Singh upon execution of the agreement. Priya is expected to start repayment from 1st October 2025.
Any event of force majeure like war, strike or pandemic will suspend obligations until 31st December 2027.
Seller Corporation shall pay a royalty fee of EUR 15,000 to John Carter on a quarterly basis.
The borrower, Nina Patel, may use a property valued at USD 1,200,000 in Mumbai, India, as collateral for this loan.
In the event of default, the interest rate increases to 8% per annum plus a late fee of 1% on aggregate outstanding principal.
Fees amounting to USD 200,000 shall be payable by the client within 10 days of receiving an invoice.
This agreement will automatically renew unless terminated by either party in writing 60 days prior to expiry.
Should mediation fail, the parties agree to submit disputes to arbitration in London as per the laws of England.
The client, David Miller, shall maintain a minimum liquidity ratio of 1.4 at all times during the loan tenure.
Borrower agrees that upon prepayment they must pay a fee of GBP 100,000 and provide 30 days’ advance written notice.
Global Holdings Ltd will disburse the loan in two tranches: first GBP 50,000, then GBP 150,000 within 90 days after signing.
A late payment charge of 0.8% per month will be applied if the client does not pay within the stipulated 60 days.
In case of bankruptcy or insolvency, either party may terminate this agreement with immediate effect.
The company, Horizon Finance, shall hold the borrower, Sarah Lee, liable to pay a processing fee of USD 75,000.
If Profits fall below 10% for two consecutive quarters, the lender may review and adjust the loan covenants.
Any change in control of the borrower entity requires written approval from the lender before any further disbursement.
The dividend payment of EUR 45,000 to shareholders shall happen within 14 days after record date 31st December 2025.
Customer, Emily Davis, must maintain collateral equal to 70% of the loan value, failure to do so will trigger default conditions.
The investor, Global Equity Partners, may require audited financial statements annually for review.
If the debt to equity ratio exceeds 2.0, the lender has the right to demand immediate repayment.
A subordinated fee of USD 250,000 will be paid to the underwriting bank upon final closing of the transaction.
The Guarantor, Peter Wong, shall guarantee up to USD 1,000,000 of the loan principal.
If an event of default occurs, the interest rate will reset to 9% per annum and a penalty of 1% will apply.
Payments to consultants amounting to GBP 200,000 must be made within 30 days of invoice date 20th February 2025.
The lender agrees to disburse USD 500,000 into the borrower’s account on 1st May 2025, subject to board approval.
Upon breach, the borrower, Maria Rodriguez, will pay default interest of 7% per annum until cure or termination.
The service provider, Delta Services Inc., shall invoice the client monthly and charge a recurring fee of EUR 5,000.
If a party wishes to assign the agreement, they must obtain prior written consent 60 days before the effective date of 1st September 2025.
All payments in default shall accrue interest on a daily basis at the rate of 0.03% until paid in full.
The client, Oliver Twist, must maintain a debt service coverage ratio (DSCR) of at least 1.25 through the life of the loan.
A guarantee fee of USD 10,000 is payable annually by the guarantor, Lisa Wong, for the term of the guarantee.
Either Party may terminate this agreement for convenience by giving 90 days’ prior written notice.
In case of insolvency, the lender may take over the borrower’s business and call a meeting of creditors within 30 days.
The underwriter, Global Securities Corp, will receive underwriting compensation of GBP 1,500,000 at closing.
If the borrower fails to maintain the agreed working capital balance, the lender may impose a penalty fee of 2% per month.
The agreement shall be governed by the laws of Switzerland and all disputes shall be resolved by mediation in Zurich.
The Client, Robert King, must pay all outstanding invoices by 15th August 2025, failing which interest will accrue.
A prepayment penalty shall apply if the borrower repays more than USD 300,000 in any 12-month period without prior consent.
Fees for administrative services will be charged at GBP 20,000 per annum by Alpha Admin Ltd.
The borrower, Carlos Santana, shall execute a lien on his residential property in Madrid, Spain, valued at EUR 750,000.
Interest rate will be revised to 5.5% per annum every 5 years based on the London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR).
If government regulations change, either party may renegotiate the terms or terminate this agreement with 120 days’ notice.
A bonus of USD 500,000 will be paid to the management team if earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) exceed EUR 2,000,000.
This agreement includes a confidentiality obligation: the parties must not disclose proprietary data to any third party for 10 years.
The loan shall be repaid in monthly instalments of USD 25,000 starting on 1st February 2026.
In the event of material breach, the lender may demand immediate repayment of the full outstanding principal.
Upon signing the contract, the borrower, Linda Wright, shall pay an upfront fee of EUR 100,000 within 5 days.
If either party suffers a force majeure event such as flood or earthquake, obligations will be suspended for up to 180 days.
The lender, Horizon Capital, requires the borrower to maintain a debt-to-equity ratio not exceeding 1.8 at all times.
The client, Robert Lewis, is expected to maintain liquidity ratio of 1.3 during the loan period. Failure to do so will result in a covenant breach.
A termination fee of USD 250,000 applies if the borrower prepays before the maturity date of 31st December 2030.
If the value of the collateral falls by more than 20%, the lender may call for a maintenance margin within 30 days.
The servicing fee of USD 75,000 shall be paid at the end of each quarter by the client company, Phoenix LLC.
If either party is declared insolvent, the remaining principal plus accrued interest becomes due immediately.
A standby fee of EUR 10,000 is payable annually by the applicant, Mr. Henry Adams, until drawdown.
The lender may require audited annual accounts from the borrower, Samantha White, as a covenant.
Upon maturity on 31st December 2028, the borrower will repay all outstanding principal and any interest due.
If the borrower refinances the loan before the 5‑year mark, a breakage fee of GBP 80,000 will apply.
The contract shall be governed by the laws of Australia and any dispute shall be settled in New South Wales.
A pledge agreement was signed between North Star Capital and Emma Watson on 1st November 2025 to secure USD 300,000 of the loan.
The lender may increase the interest to 10% per annum on the event of a downgrade in the borrower’s credit rating.
If the borrower elects to pay interest only for the first year, no amortization of principal is required.
The underwriting bank, Blue Ridge Finance, will receive a structuring fee of EUR 250,000 upon closing of the transaction.
If the loan-to-value (LTV) ratio exceeds 80%, the lender may request additional security.
All refinancing proposals must be submitted at least 90 days before the maturity date of 31st March 2029.
A default event triggered by non-payment may result in cross-default if other obligations of the borrower are outstanding.
If there is a change in law that adversely affects the lender, the borrower may renegotiate pricing or terminate the agreement with 120 days’ notice.
The agent, Global Transaction Services, shall be paid an agency fee of USD 40,000 per quarter.
Upon occurrence of a material adverse change, the lender may demand immediate repayment of all amounts outstanding.
The employee, Sarah Connor, will receive stock options valued at GBP 500,000 if the company meets earnings targets.
If bullet repayment is chosen, the full principal of EUR 2,000,000 is to be paid on maturity date 30th June 2031.
The company, Green Energy Ltd, must report quarterly revenues exceeding USD 1,000,000 to the board of lenders.
In the event of a takeover, the outstanding balance must be repaid within 180 days of control change.
If the borrower breaches the covenants, the interest rate resets to 12% per annum and a default fee of USD 25,000 may apply.
A break‑fee of EUR 20,000 will be payable in case of early termination initiated by the borrower.
The lender, Titan Capital, may enforce cross‑default if the borrower fails to pay under any other loan facility.
All interest payments shall be made in USD through wire transfers to the bank account specified by the lender.
